timeline.bodyText: Are we eventually going to support multiple forms again, or will forms eventually become form?
timeline.author: scolsen

replies.bodyText: The idea is that we'll keep it in the data store schema, but not in the UIs. This way custom or future clients can use multiple forms without breaking the database.
replies.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: Gotcha, maybe this is worthy of a helper method to make sure we always call .get(0) for now to fetch only the first form and don't accidentally call .get(0±n)? (Not that I anticipate us needing to call this in many other places in the app atm).
replies.author: scolsen

replies.bodyText: I'll go you one better - pushing the cardinality change to the persistence layers, so that the application model doesn't reflect this idiosyncrasy in the data models. Please see latest commit 56cfa3d.

timeline.bodyText:
Doesn't the fact that this is nullable obviate the use of the ArrayList or any type with an empty state? Is it possible for us to remove the potential null--or is that necessary because of unknowns in the firebase side (random data wipes, etc.)
I'm guessing it's the latter, so not blocking on this.
timeline.author: scolsen

replies.bodyText: That's exactly right.. It would if we controlled how the field was populated, but since we don't know if the Firebase API will set a null or empty we need to check both.
replies.author: gino-m
